intro: Ervatamia bovina, commonly known as the cow's milk plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Ervatamia bovina is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
